MS MCQs

    Enable secure access to apps for external users with Azure AD B2C - What is Azure AD B2C?

    »

    1. Why is a B2C tenant needed for you to use Azure AD B2C?

      Because a B2C tenant is a logical representation of your internal users and the applications they use.

      Because a B2C tenant is a logical representation of your customers and the applications they use.

      Because a tenant is a physical representation of your users and the applications they use.


    2. Patients must be able to access the health application by using their LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook accounts. How can you support that in your app?

      You can configure social identity providers. But, for a single application, only one social account type can be used at a time.

      Social identity accounts can’t be used with Azure AD B2C. Only accounts that you manage can be used to access the application.

      Select the social identity providers for these types of social accounts, and then configure them appropriately.


    3. You want to collect the patient’s job title, if they have one, when they sign up for your application. How do you do that?

      Configure a user flow and set it to collect a job-title attribute.

      Configure a social identity provider and set it to collect a job title attribute.

      Configure a custom page-layout template and put a text box in it to collect job titles.
